ncochran.controller

Class AddEdgeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ncochran.controller.AddEdgeController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class AddEdgeController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    The AddEdgeController is a MouseListener used to add a valid Edge to the Decision Lines Event at the location a user releases their mouse. The Edge must be within the assigned workspace and cannot be too close to other Edges.
    Author:
    Nigel Cochran

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      AddEdgeController(DecisionLinesEvent event)

    • Method Detail

      • runEdgeController

        public void runEdgeController(java.awt.Point point)
        This method adds a valid Edge to the DecisionLinesEvent when the User releases a mouse click. If it is an invalid Edge, then the Edge is not added and the User is notified via the console. The method first determines the Lines at the end points of the edge which also validates the Edge. It then redraws the Gui with this Edge then checks to see if this was the last Edge. If it was the last Edge, it disables the User's ability to add Edges and has the DecisionLinesEvent calculate the results.
        Parameters:
        point - Point An x,y point which is where the mouse was released
